website_summaries.verdict: With more than enough space, some will be using Corsair's 64GB as a replacement for an external hard drive. Transferring this much data though will leave you wishing for more speed.
pros: A huge amount of space means you could run an operating system happily from the drive
cons: A huge amount of space means you'll be begging for extra speed

customer_reviews.title: Iron man award
customer_reviews.text: OK i have owned this almost 8 years. It has been washed and dried (a few times) dropped 3 floors bouncing off pipes and catwalks in a power plant, thrown, dropped, binders dropped on it, spilled coffee on it, emptied water bottles in my backpack on it; seriously. I STILL carry it every day in my messenger bag and sync folders at work I have this and a 16GB version. I have trashed a half dozen plastic sliding junk both USB 2 and 3 and this thing still is going strong. It is not my fastest by any means, but it's the one I trust.
customer_reviews.author: MarkO

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these Corsair Flash Drives. They seem to be designed to protect the memory, and the design itself is a little bit more modern than other brands. And because they have extra padding, they tend to be a little bit bulkier than some of the cheaper skinny flash drives. But they feel good in your hand. I have never experienced an issue with their functionality. With regard to value, I have to say there are some cheaper ones out there, but the reviews on them are less than stellar. I haven't had any issues with these and therefore I can recommend them without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Terry A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The one good thing I have to say about this drive is that it's relatively fast at reading/writing. However, it's not even close to the advertised 16Gb of storage space. It's common for that number to be off a little on all storage drives, but this one only has 12.2Gb of space available. Almost 4Gb is NOT a little bit. That's a fourth of the advertised memory that isn't there! Since I had to use this for a OS recovery backup for my laptop which required 11.8Gb of space, I had barely enough room for it! Corsair/Amazon needs to point this out for customers who actually need the space advertised. Otherwise, you'll be in for the same surprise as me!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Get something cheaper and with more space than this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on the review of another, someone I'd like to slap right now. The reviewer was talking about it's speed, and I wanted a USB drive that would work well for streaming video on my tv. Well I've had all kinds of problems with this drive freezing up while I'm watching films and I'm sick of it. I could have bought a cheap micro center brand 32 gig for cheaper and it would be better than this. Only thing I'll buy from corsair anymore is their power supplies, never had a problem with one of those...yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Won't Eject Consistently on Mac
customer_reviews.text: I own several of these in 8GB, 16GB, and 32GB, and they all worked OK On Mac OS X prior to Mavericks, but on Mavericks and Yosemite these refuse to Eject! On ALL of these that I own I always have to Force Eject and even then sometimes they won't, so I wind up just unplugging them. I recently bought a Patriot Supersonic Rage 64GB and it works flawlessly and always Ejects on the first try, no matter what version of OS X the computer is running.
customer_reviews.author: William P. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, solid, reliable
customer_reviews.text: I got this USB stick to install and boot my FreeNAS operating system from. I keep my data in a secure cloud location and don't need to a portable storage solution other than my phone. I bought this one because it had great reviews on different sites, and more than one FreeNAS use said that they used it as a reliable boot device. My requirements weren't very complicated , a reliable stick to boot my computer from ( all of the drives are for data storage ) that was compatible with FreeNAS. The Voyager got the job done for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Komrad

customer_reviews.title: 10 Year Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these drives in anticipation of Windows 10 coming July 29th. Note that these are NOT USB3, but that really isn't needed for OS installation which would use them as READ devices. If being used as Read/Write, I would go for USB3. Very solid and protected drive with an activity light and lanyard loop; 10 year warranty. I use the lanyard loops on my OS USB drives for little white tags on a string to identify the contents of the drive.
customer_reviews.author: MarkS

customer_reviews.title: Great high capacity flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive mainly for the capacity, and having 16GB has been fantastic. It allows me to back up all important data and photos, which is not only a good idea for backup purposes, but enables my data to be completely transportable without taking a laptop. The rubberized unit is attractive, water resistant, and apparently indestructible. The data transfer seemed somewhat slow when I received the unit...noticeably slower than my 4GB Apacer drive. But I reformatted the Corsair Flash Drive using Windows Vista, and it sped things up. On a 2GB test, it sped up the transfer rate by about 35%. All in all, this is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Load's of Space, Don't Lose the Cap!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16GbB Voyager for work as I am a marketing manager and often need to carry large photoshop and image files with me. I like the included strap which you can wear around your neck. It connects securely via a "lobster claw" hook to the rubberized "o-ring". Once removing the rubber cap and inserting into my XP based PC, it's recognized quickly as an external drive. Transfer rates are quick. The drive being fully housed in rubber appears to have additional protection from dirt and moisture, although I havent put it to the test. Based on my experience, I'd purchase one again.
customer_reviews.author: V0X

customer_reviews.title: Have to format everytime i plug it
customer_reviews.text: No complains as far as amazon shipping and handling, but this is what i think about it so far, i own a similar 4GB and using it since more than 4 years and never had a single problem well thought lets get 32Gb this time ,it worked fine for couple of days but since then whenever i plug it in i get a popup to format the device, now that kills the purpose of keeping the files on a 32 Gb drive where you always just have to format it, i have contacted corsair and my ticket # is 6006619, Hopefully if they will address this issue, i will edit this review and change the ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Noman A.

customer_reviews.title: Optimal balance.
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy flash drive - advantageous to field applications (though one must be careful not to lose the lid which is not secured to the unit, a minor shortfall). Works flawlessly and installs instantaneously (I use it with various Windows XP laptops and desktops). Speed is good and matches the data advertised on Corsair's website. I find it a good balance between comfort (size and carrying options) and sturdiness (shock-resistence and splash-proofness) because I need it for field use. I prefer to use a smaller unit for exclusive indoor applications. For mixed (office & field) applications - it's the best product I've used.
customer_reviews.author: N Velvart

customer_reviews.title: favorite flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through many portable flash drives over the years. After purchasing this drive - I am now exclusive to Corsair. I like everything about this drive. - pretty quick file transfer speed - no doo doo software - made of quality materials (I like the rubber grip) - I even like the way it looks - illuminating LED I was a bit concerned at first, thinking that I may lose the protective cap - no problems. If you want a no nonsense flash drive, get the Corsair Flash Voyager.
customer_reviews.author: buybot181

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this little device. I bought it to back up my music drive in case of a crash and it transferred just under 4gb in less than 10 minutes! The rubber casing is excellent -- the only reason I didn't rate at 5 stars is the fact that the rubber tip cover slides off a little too easily and probably will be lost someday. The included encryption software was just superfluous to me so I deleted it to save space. If I want an encrypted drive I'll buy another one of these as the price is right -- I remember when these thumb drives cost an arm and a leg. All in all, a great product!
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product; Watch the cap!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great USB flash memory drive with large storage capacity and good speed. The protective shell is very sturdy and does a great job protecting the insides. I have purchased several models of these Corsair Voyagers. The protective cap fell off and disappeared from the first 8Gig Voyager very soon after I got it. I sent Corsair an e-mail and they sent me a new cap. The cap on the 32Gig Corsair Voyager I purchased this past month seems to stay on much better. I think Corsair got wise to the problem and changed the inside surface of the cap to increase friction. The cap is no longer a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: recorded music on two diff ones and it worked great for a few weeks then would skip and progressively get more frequent till it would skip whole songs lol deleted n reloaded and once again was fine for a few weeks the would degrade so I bout a sundisk and its worked for a couple yrs with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R Kravitz

customer_reviews.title: Epic FAILURE!!
customer_reviews.text: Have had nothing but great experience with corsair flash drives, This drive does not work, will slowly download files and wont replay them on device intended. That being said have had nothing but great experience with the corsair 4 and 32 gig versions. Also this unit doesn't include the lanyard cable as described and is why I chose to purchase. 2 times this drive failed me, 1st one and replacement. Oh and im giving one star I don't hate anything..
customer_reviews.author: Mondoe

customer_reviews.title: For School
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Corsair after using the same one. First one was for my daughter when she entered HS and when she graduated (and took this with her to college) I went and bought another for my son as he entered HS. With the "cloud" coming into play, these aren't used much, ... but used on occasion when using the cloud isn't convenient! Great product, never any issues with it, and would recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: R. Kunkel

customer_reviews.title: I like that it clips to my lanyard
customer_reviews.text: I have to carry my key with me for work and home use so the rubber insulated key is perfect and the hole at the tops allows it to clip to my lanyard. It would also do well on a key chain since it is so well insulated. If anything happened to my data between home and work I would be in trouble, so I depend a great deal on this key and haven't had any issues so far. It seems to be built tough enough for daily use, although, I do wish it was more attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Paula .S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of Flash Drives and all of them, except one, have proven to be reliable over the years. However, none of them are as solid and well designed as the Corsair Flash Voyager drives. I highly recommend this product because it stands out from the crowd in design and construction. If and when I ever need another Flash Drive, it will definitely be a Corsair. By the way, if you need encryption on the drive, download the excellent free program called True Crypt.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday. One reviewer commented that it did not protrude far enough from the rubber jacket to insert fully. On my Toshiba laptop it had 1/8" to spare. It goes to the hilt on my Dell Optiplex 745. Works fine, but might be a bit slower than my Cruzer (hence 4 instead of 5 stars). I like the water resistance, tactile rubber coating, looks, and amount of storage. I have all the usual portable apps on here (Firefox, Apache, OpenOffice, Gimp, etc.) with room to spare. I'm glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Long

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast and Reliable USB Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the 4 GB Corsair for several months, and have been very please with its speed, reliability, and durability. The cap does come off quite easily, and I actually lost it a few weeks ago, but I replaced the cap with a very inexpensive generic flash drive cap that works fine. I've used several different USB flash drives over the years, including ones made by Memorex, PNY, and now this brand. By far, the Corsair is the fastest and easiest to use. I will be sticking to this brand from now on. Aneil
customer_reviews.author: Aneil

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for and needed!
customer_reviews.text: This slim little memory stick worked perfect for what I needed it for. I was looking to rebuild my computer and didn't want to lose any of my documents, movies, or songs so put them on this little baby and they all survived the rebuilding. The rubber cover over the USB pins didn't stay on worth anything, but the necklace holder was nice. I also didn't use the encription program that came on the drive, but I can see that it would be helpful if I needed to move things and didn't want them stoen if I lost the stick.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Nance

customer_reviews.title: Durable flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research, and looking at all aspects (speed, durability, customer reviews) I went with the Corsair. I wanted to download my entire music library onto one flash drive and this writes fairly quickly; reading is also quick. It's got a cool water-proof case, the only issue you may have is the bulkiness of it, to put it next to another USB port, if too close together, may not work. However am satisfied with this purchase and would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: L Hochart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I've got some old equipment that apparently doesn't like any of the newer high capacity thumb-drives. 8GB is the max, and even then not all brands or models. This Corsair 8GB Voyager works perfectly. It's formated FAT32 and has 7.2GB of available space. Windows 7 Pro recognized it right away and was able to install the driver for it with no problems. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. R.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great memory! Encryption not so hot.
customer_reviews.text: The storage has been great; I haven't tried using the robber eyehole for a strap because I read in the reviews that it tends to break, and I have tried to use the 'free' encryption and found it difficult to use, ultimately I ended up with one megabyte encrypted that I can't use. Meh. I haven't yet lost the lid, though it is easy to lose. I highly recommend the product, and also recommend using some other encryption software if you want to encrypt files. PGP, for example, is pretty user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Kaze9999

customer_reviews.title: a great flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the flash drive to replace my other drive which only had 2GB. I use it for work (I am an IT engineer at a major TV network in NY)and for personal projects too..in particular it is handy for delivering large photo files and text changes to my book designer, as I am also an author and publisher. I have only one complaint: and that is the rubber cap kept coming off and now the cap is gone, so that's not a great design as the drive hangs around my neck most of the time, and I'm concerned about static discharge, but drive works great even with the missing cap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flash drive for both my wife and I for going to college. It is very durable the rubber casing really provides good protection, it is USB 2.0 though, so it is not lightning fast however you will manage. I would recommend this flash drive to anyone who is going to have this thing strapped to your side at all times. Note: the cap is easy to lose, but just put it back on every time your finished with it
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Was a great flash drive with nice rugged look and function
customer_reviews.text: Was a great flash drive with nice rugged look and function. Unfortunately i lost it :( Ended up getting the USB3.0 version later though :) The best part, had it on my car keychain, and the cap never once fell off !
customer_reviews.author: Prem Siddharth Gunamalai

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it seems
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with many of the reviews here. After having tried many different USB flash memories, I have to say this one comes short of what I expected. I can name a few disappointing things: - bulky design - may be water resistant but it easily bent from the adapter and died, so it's not so rugged after all - compared to other flash memories it has SLOW performance, specially when transfering many small files. the slowest I've ever tried. - cap comes off easily
customer_reviews.author: O. Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 30 days and its replacement within 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very disappointed by this USB drive. The first one stopped working within the first 30 days of usage and its replacement - fast and without problems from amazon - stopped working 5 months later. After pluging the USB drive into the computer its light flashes for a few seconds up to several minutes and then after that time it suddenly stops and is not visible on the Computer. This happened on several PCs/Macs and on USB 1.1 and 2.0 ports while cheaper no-name brand flash drives work perfectly. I only can encourage people with a defect drive to use the 10 year limited warranty by corsair: [...] or by phone: 1-888-222-4346
customer_reviews.author: Shaken Not Stirred

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I took a trip to Holland last year and there were so many pictures on my computer it was slowing it down in my opinion. I wanted to be able to look thru them whenever I wanted to but not bog down my computer too. This was the answer. I have all of my pictures on here and they can be easily flipped thru. It's coated in a lovely sturdy material that isn't nearly as fragile feeling as some of the others I've seen on the market. I'd recommend this to anyone. Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: Slower than Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product description says 12MB/sec which implies 12 megabytes per second. Other reviews even say it is faster than this. In my testing I usually get 3MB/sec with a confirmed EHCI "High Speed" USB port. This is much slower than advertised. Aside from the slower speed, it seems fine, but I do worry that I will lose the cap one day. UPDATE: It failed after a few months. It seems to easily overheat inside that rubber case.
customer_reviews.author: Warren I

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable USB flash drive
customer_reviews.text: Its a great USB flash drive to carry around, its rubberized outside makes it better likely to handle drops. Also easy to grip. Its not as fast or as slim as the Sony 16gb flash drive but I feel this would be better to carry around then the Sony or the Cruzier flash drive. Also its a bit bulky so on a crowded USB hub you may have to remove some thing for it to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Soto

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but needs a better design
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. It does what it is supposed to do. However, I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because its design makes it less convenient with plugging it in next to other USB devices. It comes with an extension USB cord to solve the problem, but it's just less convenient to have to use this cord every time. Also, the cap falls off very easily. I wanted to give it only 3 stars because of its design, but the most important thing is its functionality. Bottom line: it works. It just has design flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rozar

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: PROS 1) It's a very good quality flash drive compared to the rest of the flash drives. 2) The flash drive material is very durable. Other flash drives, which are usually made out of hard plastic, would easily break if you were to accidentally step on them. CONS 1) It is a little bit heavier than most flash drives, but most would agree this is something insignificant.
customer_reviews.author: T. Salazar

customer_reviews.title: unreliable and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased this USB 2.0 version of the Flash Voyager. It stopped working after a few short months, not allowing my to access any information it had on it. I replaced it with the 3.0 version. Six months later it stopped working. I went to Corsair's website and filled out the warranty form for replacement a few weeks ago and still haven't heard back. Truth be told I really don't want a replacement anyway because I don't feel that I can trust their products. Do yourself a favor and purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis B.

customer_reviews.title: best out there
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite thumb drive out there i keep it on my keys so it has been through a lot and has not faulted once. You might be able to find better amount of storage for a little less but you will not find better build quality. I used it as a bootable Linux drive for a while and now I'm using it as a external Xbox 360 drive it has exceeded my expectations in both regards.
customer_reviews.author: The Barren

customer_reviews.title: Great flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered several of this brand of flash drive over the past 2 years and they are always durable and reliable. It has a nice rubberized exterior to protect it. It would be nice if there were a better way to cap it since it's always possible to lose that separate piece, but other than that I have nothing but great things to say about this product. Only once did I have a faulty one and it was promptly replaced.
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: Corsair Flash Voyager is a very good quality flash drive. I had Corsair flash drives before. They all were good. This one is very good and I think I will buy more flash drives from the same company. Also, having 16 GB space is great! I saved tons of images on this flash drive and didn't even use half of flash drive space.
customer_reviews.author: gkot

customer_reviews.title: Good and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Received it on time and it works fine. I paid a little more for this because of the speed - and it is worth it. Amoung other uses, I use it to run a portable application (Abyss web server - with PHP and Perl) to test the Web Apps I write - and it does that very well. I can run it on any computer that has a USB port. But it shines when copying large files - the speed is noticeably faster than other thumb drives.
customer_reviews.author: Hal in Augusta

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th USB drive. I upgrade about once a year for larger capacity. I like a drive I can keep on my keychain, so it needs a strong mounting point. Most of the ones I researched are not setup for this type of use. This drive has a good attachment point plus it is sturdy and rubberized. The end cap seems durable and holds on well. Drive seems fairly fast too. So... Good drive. Good price. Happy Man.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Henderson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement was faster, but re-write is pretty slow.
customer_reviews.text: Original: I needed the size so I have kept it. I think there is a defect in it that makes it run at USB 1.1 speeds. I have no problem with the other keys that I have. I would suggest trying a different product. UPDATE: The company sent a replacement that is much faster. However, write speeds are still very slow when re-writing. This is understandable given the technology. However, the SanDisk 64GB flash drive I have is much more responsive.
customer_reviews.author: W. Poucher

customer_reviews.title: Seems OK to me
customer_reviews.text: Well, it does what it's suppose to do. I would give it 5 stars except I'm so sorry I didn't check to see if it had a LED light to indicate when it's working. I just didn't think to check for that feature. I have it on all my others, and just took it for granted that it would be there. I won't make that mistake again. Though it seems to work fine, I sure miss that feature.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Armor is nice as well as the visible LED light
customer_reviews.text: Speedout and Flashbench in Win 8.1 gave ~ Read 23 Mb/sec Write 12 Mb/sec. Real world copy from desktop to this drive give middle of the road speeds for 2.0 drive. A couple I have are 20% faster, but most are 20-70% slower. Armor is nice as well as the visible LED light. Very nice drive.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ion May

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Memory pretty good, would not hold all of my documents, because I have collected quite a few. Perfect for what I used it for to replace a Sandisk that came apart. I believe this one will live longer, just hope thumb drives will last long enough to live up to quality. Upped my storage space.
customer_reviews.author: 4NeedShopper

customer_reviews.title: 2.0 flash drive 16 GB
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best brands of USB flash drives on the market! you don't find them in stores at all. they will last for a long time if you treat them well. I used this brand for many yrs and just love them, great for storage of data,pic,music,documents,movies you name it.
customer_reviews.author: geannie eades

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay . .
customer_reviews.text: This is a very rugged USB Flash Drive. On the other hand, it is very bulky,and doesn't fit well in tight spots where there are other USB devices , like in the back of the computer. I didn't find this Flash Drive was particularly fast . . about average in that regard. In fact, the flash drive was so slow, that it can't be used for Vista Ready-Boost.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: A great value.
customer_reviews.text: A great value, especially with the 10 year guarantee. Other thumb drives have given out on me after a couple of years. I have used it to cover all of my data, and it still has plenty of space for more.
customer_reviews.author: steamduck43

customer_reviews.title: Good Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive has a significant amount of space and is "hardened" against shock (rubberized coating). This also keeps it from getting a five star rating from me. It is a tad thick if you want to stack something else in a close USB port, but of course the coating which makes it thick also gives it protection, so it depends on what you are looking for. This is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: HARBINGER

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, One Gripe
customer_reviews.text: I don't find much to differentiate among better flash drives, and the performance of the Corsair is certainly very good. My only gripe is with the friction cap, which simply doesn't stay put. It's particularly annoying if you actually carry the thing on a strap around your neck, as it tends to fall off inside your shirt or trousers. Bugs me enough that I probably wouldn't buy another one. Obviously others may have a different opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fast write/read. Virtually inestructible
customer_reviews.text: Not the cheapest, but you get what you pay for. I have used several of these over the past year or more. All are still functioning fine. Not that I abuse them, but it is nice to have a flash drive I can travel with and not be overly worried about it getting wet, full of pocket lint, or broken.
customer_reviews.author: W.P.

customer_reviews.title: wow!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you absolutely cannot get more storage in a more protected flash drive! I an a teacher and keep all my documents and files on this to keep with me when I move from room to room. It is easy and doesn't lose files even when washed! I am ordering another to keep as backup, and may order an even dozen to give to friends and colleagues!
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock. Love mine!"
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 thumb drives, and this is my second Corsair. These things are solid as a rock. I honestly believe you could run over it with a truck. My only complaint is the flimsy cap which won't stay on. Long ago, I decided--because these Corsairs are bulletproof--to just ditch the cap, attach the drive to my ring of keys, and move right on. No problems. Love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jerry Parks, National Teacher's Hall of Fame, 2009

customer_reviews.title: Useful one
customer_reviews.text: As always thank you Amazon.com for great service I've got this item in time. Generally speaking it works well, good looking, comfortable to hold and carry, strong reliable well protected from moisture case. There are some concerns: 1.It's a bit bulky. I have two USB ports close to each other. If I plug Corsair in one of those I can't use second one(no room for another USB connector) 2.To download 7,5 GB file it took about half an hour. You may compare download time yourself it you have an experience with different flash drives. 3.Corsair memory can't take 8GB file. It is few hundred MB short. 4.4GB Corsair has security lock software. 8 GB one comes without it.
customer_reviews.author: Valentin

customer_reviews.title: I washed this one!!
customer_reviews.text: First thing, I accidentally washed & dried this flash drive & it still works! Buy it just for the durability. My only complaint is how drive manufacturers mis-represent storage space. This 16Gb drive has only 14.3Gb usable space. It's been going on forever, so nothing will change there. Just wish they would advertise by usable space.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer II

customer_reviews.title: XBOX 360 Slim Compatible!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after researching which flash drives were compatible with XBOX360. Item arrived in perfect condition. Popped it into the back of my unit and proceeded to initialize it. After a couple of minutes it was ready and the XBOX360 informed me it passed the performance tests. Ordered my second one as a result.
customer_reviews.author: MK.ca

customer_reviews.title: Alberto Reviewed  June 24, 2007
customer_reviews.text: My new Corsair USB 2 16GB Flash Voyager Drive is the best! I use it to transfer and store my high-definition photos. I couldn't be happier with the quality and price from Amazon.com!. It's fast and I haven't lost a bit of data. I highly recommend it.I love this, I am able to take everything with me rather than drag the computer along. A bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Lordbert 13

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Got this in the mail, plugged it in, and it works. It does create a window in WinXP that says I could get faster service if I plugged into a USB 2.0 port...but my computer doesn't have one. I haven't dropped it in anything wet to test the waterproof claim. Of course, I assume that claim is only valid if the rubber cap is over the business end!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Carman

customer_reviews.title: Good jump drive
customer_reviews.text: Water resistant saves buying lots of the lessor expensive plastic flash drives.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Peck

customer_reviews.title: Loved it as long as I had it.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and went into immediate use. However, the curse of all Flash Drives occurred. No sooner did I get it and I either misplaced it or maybe someone else liked it better than I did and apprehended it for their collection. I am still longing for one of these. I have another one. Love the Corsair line of Flash Drives.
customer_reviews.author: DavyJonzLokr

customer_reviews.title: Better than most, not great...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this flash drive. It is pretty secure and made very well. The top stays on tight and there aren't any design flaws. The one thing I have a problem with is the slow read/write times when using it on a PS3. It is probably the slowest device I've ever seen move files to and from. Overall great, just watch put for the PS3 flaw...
customer_reviews.author: T. Savage

customer_reviews.title: The perfect utility for moving data between businessmen and women.
customer_reviews.text: These flash drives are just the thing for getting data and moving it from one computer to another. The purpose we purchased these was to send the data I had with three other people in other areas of the world.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Moore

customer_reviews.title: The case is great
customer_reviews.text: I had a 16GB just like this 32GB. I'm not gentle handling flash disks. Throw it around, keep it in my pocket with keys and change. The vinyl (rubber?) case protects it MUCH better than any plastic one I've owned. And the cover always stays in place. No more cheap Kingston or San Disk ones for me again.
customer_reviews.author: A Nurd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a USB drive but I've not gotten it wet.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Chavers

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an 8 GB Corsair drive in 2007. It has the thick rubber coating. It worked quite well for over a year. I did not do a lot of heavy use, but maybe three times a month I used it. Speed was adequate it seemed. Some USB slots it would not fit into because the rubber is too thick. I carried it in my pocket all the time. After about 14 months it suddenly stopped working. Dead. The computer tells me to reformat it, but I have chosen not to destroy the data in case some day I figure out how to get it off. I will purchase another brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Right Sized and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to say whether this flash drive is good, All I know is that I have it online 100% of the time and do not have any data problems, it's just sort of transparent. I think the 16 GB works great as an auxiliary storage device. And the price was right too.
customer_reviews.author: AMNSBFL

customer_reviews.title: Very fast!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought it two days ago and loving it. This thing is very very fast! I put my mp3 10mb file on it and it just flew with about 1-1.4 seconds and done. My 2GB file consisting of mp3's and pdf's didn't take long either, about 10 minutes or less. It comes with TrueCrypt encryption system too. So go and get it if you want flash drive, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Freelands Books

customer_reviews.title: very top nub of lid pops off very easily. And lid is loose sometimes (I've gone through ...
customer_reviews.text: My PCs often do not recognize the flash drive. Also, very top nub of lid pops off very easily. And lid is loose sometimes (I've gone through a few)
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: It's Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Voyager flash drive. I like this drive because it's small, portable, and the 4GB storage capacity is much more useful than the 2GB I owned previously. The only downside of these drives would be that they are fragile -- if you aren't careful, you can bend and break off the USB connector end, which destroys the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Too big for slim xbox 360s
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Seems like durable rubberized shell, cap fits nice and snug. Cap does not have lanyard hole, does not stick to the back end when in use, so it was easy to lose. This does work fine with my xbox 360s, but it only fits in the front usb ports, and it does not share those very well.
customer_reviews.author: Old Hat

customer_reviews.title: I hope you don't mind a dirty, capless  flash drive
customer_reviews.text: This thing works pretty well. However, the rubber cover attracts a lot of dust, which is pretty much impossible to get off. Also, after you use it for a while, the cap becomes loose and falls of by itself. I was very careful with it, but I still lost it because it just fell off somewhere. Other than that, the drive is fast and reliable. It's not really portable, compared with other USB drives these days, and it's not as durable as the rubber layer might have you believe (there's no other housing under the rubber except the drive). In terms of performance, this drive is pretty good, but I would recommend another flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Decent buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent drive and is reasonably fast for documents interchange. I use it primarily to exchange data between my windows machine at work and linux machine at home. It works "out of the box" on both operating systems. I have not owned it for more then 2 weeks now, so cant say about long term guarantee - but its been working like a charm till now.
customer_reviews.author: Dandruffian

customer_reviews.title: Good Flash Drive, but....
customer_reviews.text: This one arrived to me broken, and had to return it. I have used these before, and they have held up well, but not this one. I was so looking forward to using it to back up my files, but so such luck.
customer_reviews.author: Skyhawk

customer_reviews.title: corsair replaced lost cap quickly and for free!
customer_reviews.text: i almost never lose things but nevertheless lost the cap to my cute little rubber-covered flash drive within a month of owning it! i finally decided i'd go to the corsair website to see about buying a replacement and found out they will provide up to 5 replacement caps for free! couldn't have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: loveonlineshopping

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, overall good product delivered on time as promised !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: 2nd 1 purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 1 purchased. Encased in rubber, strong and durable. Recognizable almost everywhere. Previous flash drives owned either broke out of there plastic casing or were not recognized by my MAC.
customer_reviews.author: MIKER

customer_reviews.title: Life in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought a 16GB Corsair Flash Voyager was that I had filled my 8GB Corsair Flash Voyager. The Voyager has been a reliable, problem free tool for transporting my life between work and home. 8GB, 16Gb, same reliability, same ease of use, same lack of overhead. Downsides are few. The cap that covers the USB plug can wander at times. It would be useful to have it attached. Also, I have found that save times for Word documents increased when going from the 8 to 16GB versions. Quibbles. This is superior, simple technology and I do not know how I survived without it.
customer_reviews.author: Willemite

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I love the rubber housing not slippery at all and it fits in the USB port without any problems. It is a little bulky but I like it because it really looks built to handle rough use and knew that when I made my choice. Mine is the 32GB size
customer_reviews.author: Todd K

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Almost A Year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a long time. No problems, nice feel, decent price. Until, of course, it stopped working after a year. I bought two of them and they both failed at similar times. Very disappointed, as I've always been a champion for Corsair products.
customer_reviews.author: Zyde

customer_reviews.title: 8GB Voyager Drive
customer_reviews.text: Great little (big) device - dependable and fast. Only drawback is in the design of the cap. It should fit on the end (or some place convenient) when the flash drive is being used, so users don't set it down and lose it. As a daily user, I am sure I will eventually lose it sooner or later (hopefully mach later). ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Greg Weber

customer_reviews.title: Best and longest lasting flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Corsair Voyager flash drives and found them to be durable. One did fail me so I sent it back to Corsair who promptly replaced it. They have a ten year guarantee on their products - can't beat that. I highly recommend these flash drives.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Macd

customer_reviews.title: Corsair 32 GB Flash Voyager
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and can keep files and music on a neat little flash drive. I like the design and rubber coating. Could not give it a higher rating. And, Corsair is a great product company. Thanks for making the order experience good, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this flash drive for a few months and haven't had a problem. It comes with a USB extender that is really useful for all kinds of things, and a lanyard, which isn't so useful. The rubber case picks up lint if its in your pocket, which I find kind of annoying, but maybe that's just me. Overall, a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dale J. Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this flash drive for about 1 month and it has worked flawlessly. It provides me with the flexibility I was seeking to work with my critical files between my desktop and laptop. I use Allway Sync to create a backup on my desktop and laptop to insure I don't loose my data. Allway Snyc is a free product and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: A couple of years ago I purchased an 8 GB flash drive by the same manufacturer. I was very happy with the performance of that so when I wanted to buy an additional drive I went with the same brand. I am very pleased with the 16 GB as well. I would recommend this to a friend and have.
customer_reviews.author: K. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Mac-Compatible 8GB Thumbdrive
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this drive for about a month now, and it works great! It's fast, great capacity, and works seamlessly on my Mac. Unfortunately, the first one I received was dead, but with Amazon's no-questions-asked return policy, they overnighted me a new one, and I returned the broken one, with minimal effort. Overall I am very pleased with the drive. EDIT: I have been using this for over 3 months now, and have filled it to capacity many times (transferring DVD movies, etc.) and it still works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: R. Black

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Flash drives seem pretty much the same. They are more reliable, portable and durable. This one, relative to other 16 gig sticks is a good price too. My only quibble is with the design. It looks and feels cool, but it won't fit into the USB port in my keyboard because of the rounded housing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: its a flash drive
customer_reviews.text: It works fine ,I have another 16gb version for years and no problems. It's only 2.0 now that the 3.0 is everywhere but if you don't need all that speed or don't use it every day to load huge files its fine. i like the rubber casing seems to be more shock proof than most and has a cap
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Returned because I found much better deals. Not water resistant, it's no different than the standard edition.
customer_reviews.author: Common Sense Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Flash Voyager 2.0 8gb Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Great little handy device. I have purchased 5 of these. My son uses his for computer programing classes. They load fast. Very durable, you don't have to worry about breaking them. Very swappable and portable. Have used my first one for about 3 yrs. still works like new. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austin

customer_reviews.title: I have several flash drives ...
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best, both in storage volume and access speed. I use it primarily for music and video files, to move from system to system. It's a bit bulky to plug into vertically adjacent USB ports, but the extension cable assuages that issue nicely. I also like the "shockproof" design. Looks cool...and, you know, it's all about looks. Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, great casing.
customer_reviews.text: This drive does what it's supposed to do, just fine. What I especially love about it is its casing, which is a thick bodysuit-like material which makes it seem sturdier than other flash drives I've had. It feels safe to carry it in my bag without special protection. It also comes with a long cord.
customer_reviews.author: D. Loesch

customer_reviews.title: Haven't come across a better flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these over the past few years (of varying capacities). Have not had one fail yet. One has been through the washer more than once (with the lid on) and suffered no ill effects. Still working well years later.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great flash drive. Fast, durable, lots of capacity.
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is faster than average, and very well made. At 16 GB it's plenty big enough for my needs. It has a blue activity light, a snug-fitting rubber cap and rubber outer coating and a key ring loop. I haven't tested it for moisture resistance but it looks tight and is built like a tank. It's a bit bigger than average (about 2.75" in length) but for me that's a plus - I lose these things like crazy. The best flash drive I've owned. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John H Lowery

customer_reviews.title: One improvement to suggest
customer_reviews.text: I like just about everything about this flash drive. It seems well built, and Corsair has an excellent reputation. I do wish the cap was not completely detachable. I am afraid that it will be too easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Best flash ever had. Really well designed, and made. Although I haven't tried it, I believe I could slam it on the floor and you'd never know--it feels that solid. Never an issue with plug and use. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Corsair flash drive, like everything else they do wear out, and can't save data on them. It is good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: sci-fi fan

customer_reviews.title: Great USB
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16 GB drive about 2 months ago wanting a USB with a larger capacity. I read some reviews about this item having issues with transfer speed. I am really happy with the transfer rate for this USB. I use the jump drive between my Macbook and PC with no issues. This product is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ratti

customer_reviews.title: Corsair reformatted for XP
customer_reviews.text: The Corsair Voyager is a good, solid product. However, I discovered that, to have it work well with my older version of XP, I had to reformat it from FAT32 to NTFS. After that it works fine, although a tad slow. Of course it may be my 1GB RAM on the box that is contributing to the slowness.
customer_reviews.author: C. Langlois

customer_reviews.title: finally more memory
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is fast, as are most of these drives. It also seems to run on very little power - can be plugged into the usb port on a keyboard and still run. The best thing however is that its 8GB at a great price, finally. Now all we need is for 16GB and 32GB flash drives to fall in price as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Stephen

product_meta.title: Corsair CMFUSB2.0-8GB 8GB Flash Voyager USB 2.0 Flash Drive
product_meta.description:
Capacity:8GB
Customer Service / Tech support: 1-888-222-4346 opt. 1
feature_bullets: Ideal for transporting MP3's, Digital Photos, Power Point Presentations, Video Footage of the kids, and so much more!
Flash Voyager drives have been tested by dropping, boiling, baking, and even running them over with SUV's!!!
Store up to 2,000 MP3 Files! Or How about 2,480 Digital Photos! Or Store 3 hours of video footage!
Enclosed in Corsair Proprietary All-Rubber Housing ensures Water Resistance and Ultra Durability!
Our 5 Year Warranty means you can write information for 24/7 for 10 years non-stop!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,337 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
